content: 1 Paul､ an apostle,— Not from men､ nor through man, But through Jesus Christ､ and God the Father who raised him from among the dead,—
content_old: 1 Paul､ an apostle,— Not from men､ nor through man, But through Jesus Christ､ and God the Father who raised him from among the dead,—

content: 2 And all the brethren with me;— Unto the assemblies of Galatia:
content_old: 2 And all the brethren with me;— Unto the assemblies of Galatia:

content: 3 Favour unto you and peace､ From God our Father, And Lord Jesus Christ,—
content_old: 3 Favour unto you and peace､ From God our Father, And Lord Jesus Christ,—

content: 4 Who gave himself for our sins､ That he might deliver us out of the present evil age, According to the will of our God and Father,—
content_old: 4 Who gave himself for our sins､ That he might deliver us out of the present evil age, According to the will of our God and Father,—

content: 5 Unto whom be the glory unto the ages of ages: Amen!
content_old: 5 Unto whom be the glory unto the ages of ages: Amen!

content: 6 I marvel that thus quickly ye are moving away from him that called you in the favour of Christ, Unto a different glad-message,—
content_old: 6 I marvel that thus quickly ye are moving away from him that called you in the favour of Christ, Unto a different glad-message,—

content: 7 Which is not another, Only there are some that are troubling you､ And wishing to change the glad-message of the Christ.
content_old: 7 Which is not another, Only there are some that are troubling you､ And wishing to change the glad-message of the Christ.

content: 8 But even if we or a messenger out of heaven announce a glad-message unto you aside from that which we announced unto you Accursed let him be!
content_old: 8 But even if we or a messenger out of heaven announce a glad-message unto you aside from that which we announced unto you Accursed let him be!

content: 9 As we have said before､ even now again I say: If anyone is announcing unto you a glad-message aside from that which ye accepted Accursed let him be!
content_old: 9 As we have said before､ even now again I say: If anyone is announcing unto you a glad-message aside from that which ye accepted Accursed let him be!

content: 10 For am I even now persuading men or God? Or am I seeking to please men? If I had been still pleasing men Christ’s servant had I not been!
content_old: 10 For am I even now persuading men or God? Or am I seeking to please men? If I had been still pleasing men Christ’s servant had I not been!

content: 11 For I make known unto you､ brethren､ As to the glad-message which was announced by me That it is not after man;
content_old: 11 For I make known unto you､ brethren､ As to the glad-message which was announced by me That it is not after man;

content: 12 For neither from man did I accept it､ Nor was taught it,— But through a revealing of Jesus Christ.
content_old: 12 For neither from man did I accept it､ Nor was taught it,— But through a revealing of Jesus Christ.

content: 13 For ye have heard as to my own manner of life､ at one time､ in Judaism How that exceedingly was I persecuting the assembly of God､ and laying it waste,
content_old: 13 For ye have heard as to my own manner of life､ at one time､ in Judaism How that exceedingly was I persecuting the assembly of God､ and laying it waste,

content: 14 And was making advancement､ in Judaism､ above many contemporaries in my nation,— Being surpassingly zealous of my paternal instructions.
content_old: 14 And was making advancement､ in Judaism､ above many contemporaries in my nation,— Being surpassingly zealous of my paternal instructions.

content: 15 But when God､ who set me apart from my mother’s womb and called me through his favour､ Was well-pleased
content_old: 15 But when God､ who set me apart from my mother’s womb and called me through his favour､ Was well-pleased

content: 16 to reveal his Son in me, That I might announce the glad-message regarding him among the nations Straightway I conferred not with flesh and blood,
content_old: 16 to reveal his Son in me, That I might announce the glad-message regarding him among the nations Straightway I conferred not with flesh and blood,

content: 17 Neither went I up unto Jerusalem unto them who before me were apostles,— But I went away into Arabia､ and again returned unto Damascus.
content_old: 17 Neither went I up unto Jerusalem unto them who before me were apostles,— But I went away into Arabia､ and again returned unto Damascus.

content: 18 Then､ after three years went I up unto Jerusalem､ to become acquainted with Cephas, and tarried with him fifteen days;
content_old: 18 Then､ after three years went I up unto Jerusalem､ to become acquainted with Cephas, and tarried with him fifteen days;

content: 19 But other of the apostles saw I none､ save James the brother of the Lord:—
content_old: 19 But other of the apostles saw I none､ save James the brother of the Lord:—

content: 20 Now as touching the things which I am writing to you lo! before God I am not guilty of falsehood:—
content_old: 20 Now as touching the things which I am writing to you lo! before God I am not guilty of falsehood:—

content: 21 After that I went into the regions of Syria and Cilicia,
content_old: 21 After that I went into the regions of Syria and Cilicia,

content: 22 And was still unknown､ by face､ unto the assemblies of Judæa which were in Christ,—
content_old: 22 And was still unknown､ by face､ unto the assemblies of Judæa which were in Christ,—

content: 23 Only they were hearing— He that was persecuting us formerly Now is announcing the glad-message of the faith which he formerly laid waste;
content_old: 23 Only they were hearing— He that was persecuting us formerly Now is announcing the glad-message of the faith which he formerly laid waste;

content: 1 After that､ fourteen years later I again went up unto Jerusalem､ with Barnabas, Taking with me Titus also;
content_old: 1 After that､ fourteen years later I again went up unto Jerusalem､ with Barnabas, Taking with me Titus also;

content: 2 And I went up by revelation, And laid before them the glad-message which I proclaim among the nations; Privately however､ to them of repute,— Lest､ by any means､ in vain I should be running､ or had run.
content_old: 2 And I went up by revelation, And laid before them the glad-message which I proclaim among the nations; Privately however､ to them of repute,— Lest､ by any means､ in vain I should be running､ or had run.

content: 3 But not even Titus､ who was with me, though he was a Greek was compelled to be circumcised;—
content_old: 3 But not even Titus､ who was with me, though he was a Greek was compelled to be circumcised;—

content: 4 But this was because of the false brethren secretly introduced,— Who､ indeed､ came in secretly to spy out our freedom､ which we have in Christ Jesus, That they might bring us into bondage:—
content_old: 4 But this was because of the false brethren secretly introduced,— Who､ indeed､ came in secretly to spy out our freedom､ which we have in Christ Jesus, That they might bring us into bondage:—

content: 5 Unto whom､ not even for an hour gave we place by the required submission,— In order that the truth of the glad-message might still abide with you.
content_old: 5 Unto whom､ not even for an hour gave we place by the required submission,— In order that the truth of the glad-message might still abide with you.

content: 6 Moreover from them who were reputed to be something— Whatsoever at one time they were､ maketh no difference to me, God accepteth not a man’s person,— Unto me in fact､ they who were of repute added nothing further;
content_old: 6 Moreover from them who were reputed to be something— Whatsoever at one time they were､ maketh no difference to me, God accepteth not a man’s person,— Unto me in fact､ they who were of repute added nothing further;

content: 7 But on the contrary— When they saw that I had been entrusted with the glad-message to the uncircumcision, Even as Peter with that to the circumcision,—
content_old: 7 But on the contrary— When they saw that I had been entrusted with the glad-message to the uncircumcision, Even as Peter with that to the circumcision,—

content: 8 For he that energised in Peter､ into an apostleship to the circumcision Energised also in me､ for the nations,—
content_old: 8 For he that energised in Peter､ into an apostleship to the circumcision Energised also in me､ for the nations,—

content: 9 And when they perceived the favour which had been given unto me James and Cephas and John､ who were reputed to be pillars Gave the right hand of feIlowship unto me and Barnabas, In order that we should go unto the nations, And they unto the circumcision:—
content_old: 9 And when they perceived the favour which had been given unto me James and Cephas and John､ who were reputed to be pillars Gave the right hand of feIlowship unto me and Barnabas, In order that we should go unto the nations, And they unto the circumcision:—

content: 10 Only that we should remember the destitute,— As to which I had given diligence this very thing to do.
content_old: 10 Only that we should remember the destitute,— As to which I had given diligence this very thing to do.

content: 11 But when Cephas came unto Antioch To the face even him I resisted, Because he stood condemned;
content_old: 11 But when Cephas came unto Antioch To the face even him I resisted, Because he stood condemned;

content: 12 For before that certain came from James With them of the nations used he to eat; Whereas when they came He used to withdraw､ and keep himself separate, Fearing them of the circumcision;
content_old: 12 For before that certain came from James With them of the nations used he to eat; Whereas when they came He used to withdraw､ and keep himself separate, Fearing them of the circumcision;

content: 13 And the rest of the Jews also used hypocrisy with him, So that even Barnabas was carried away by their hypocrisy.
content_old: 13 And the rest of the Jews also used hypocrisy with him, So that even Barnabas was carried away by their hypocrisy.

content: 14 But when I saw that they were not walking with straightforwardness as regardeth the truth of the glad-message I said unto Cephas､ before all:— If thou although a Jew like them of the nations､ and not like the Jews dost live How dost thou compel them of the nations to live like Jews?
content_old: 14 But when I saw that they were not walking with straightforwardness as regardeth the truth of the glad-message I said unto Cephas､ before all:— If thou although a Jew like them of the nations､ and not like the Jews dost live How dost thou compel them of the nations to live like Jews?

content: 15 We､ by nature Jews, and not sinners from among the nations
content_old: 15 We､ by nature Jews, and not sinners from among the nations

content: 16 Knowing､ however､ that a man is not declared righteous by works of law, Nor at all save through faith in Christ Jesus Even we on Christ Jesus believed, That we might be declared righteous— By faith in Christ､ And not by works of law; Because by works of law shall no flesh be declared righteous.
content_old: 16 Knowing､ however､ that a man is not declared righteous by works of law, Nor at all save through faith in Christ Jesus Even we on Christ Jesus believed, That we might be declared righteous— By faith in Christ､ And not by works of law; Because by works of law shall no flesh be declared righteous.

content: 17 Now if in seeking to be declared righteous in Christ we ourselves also were found sinners— Is Christ therefore a minister of sin? Far be it!
content_old: 17 Now if in seeking to be declared righteous in Christ we ourselves also were found sinners— Is Christ therefore a minister of sin? Far be it!

content: 18 For if the things that I pulled down these again I build A transgressor I prove myself to be.
content_old: 18 For if the things that I pulled down these again I build A transgressor I prove myself to be.

content: 19 For I through means of law unto law died, That unto God I might live:—
content_old: 19 For I through means of law unto law died, That unto God I might live:—

content: 20 With Christ have I been crucified; And living no longer am I, But living in me is Christ,— While so far as I now do live in flesh By faith I live— The faith in the Son of God, Who loved me､ and gave himself up in my behalf.
content_old: 20 With Christ have I been crucified; And living no longer am I, But living in me is Christ,— While so far as I now do live in flesh By faith I live— The faith in the Son of God, Who loved me､ and gave himself up in my behalf.

content: 1 O thoughtless Galatians! Who hath bewitched you,— Before whose very eyes Jesus Christ was openly set forth as a crucified one?
content_old: 1 O thoughtless Galatians! Who hath bewitched you,— Before whose very eyes Jesus Christ was openly set forth as a crucified one?

content: 2 This only am I wishing to learn from you:— By works of law received ye the Spirit? Or by a believed report?
content_old: 2 This only am I wishing to learn from you:— By works of law received ye the Spirit? Or by a believed report?

content: 3 So thoughtless are ye? Having made a beginning in Spirit Are ye now､ in flesh to be made complete?
content_old: 3 So thoughtless are ye? Having made a beginning in Spirit Are ye now､ in flesh to be made complete?

content: 4 Such things suffered ye in vain,— If at least it is even in vain?
content_old: 4 Such things suffered ye in vain,— If at least it is even in vain?

content: 5 He then who was supplying unto you the Spirit､ and energising mighty works among you By works of law, Or by a believed report did he it?
content_old: 5 He then who was supplying unto you the Spirit､ and energising mighty works among you By works of law, Or by a believed report did he it?

content: 6 Even as Abraham— Believed in God, And it was reckoned unto him as righteousness.
content_old: 6 Even as Abraham— Believed in God, And it was reckoned unto him as righteousness.

content: 7 Be taking note therefore— That they who are of faith the same are sons of Abraham;
content_old: 7 Be taking note therefore— That they who are of faith the same are sons of Abraham;

content: 8 And the scripture Foreseeing that by faith God would declare the nations righteous Fore-announced the good news unto Abraham, saying— All the nations shall be blessed in thee.
content_old: 8 And the scripture Foreseeing that by faith God would declare the nations righteous Fore-announced the good news unto Abraham, saying— All the nations shall be blessed in thee.

content: 9 So then they who are of faith are blessed with believing Abraham;
content_old: 9 So then they who are of faith are blessed with believing Abraham;

content: 10 For as many as are of works of law are under a curse,— For it is written— Accursed is everyone that continueth not in all things that are written in the book of the law to do them.
content_old: 10 For as many as are of works of law are under a curse,— For it is written— Accursed is everyone that continueth not in all things that are written in the book of the law to do them.

content: 11 Moreover､ that in law no one is declared righteous with God is evident,— Because The righteous one by faith shall live;
content_old: 11 Moreover､ that in law no one is declared righteous with God is evident,— Because The righteous one by faith shall live;

content: 12 And the law is not of faith, but— He that hath done them shall live in them,
content_old: 12 And the law is not of faith, but— He that hath done them shall live in them,

content: 13 Christ hath redeemed us out of the curse of the law, Having become in our behalf a curse;— Because it is written— Cursed is everyone that hangeth upon a tree;—
content_old: 13 Christ hath redeemed us out of the curse of the law, Having become in our behalf a curse;— Because it is written— Cursed is everyone that hangeth upon a tree;—

content: 14 In order that unto the nations the blessing of Abraham might come about in Jesus Christ,— In order that the promise of the Spirit we might receive through means of the faith.
content_old: 14 In order that unto the nations the blessing of Abraham might come about in Jesus Christ,— In order that the promise of the Spirit we might receive through means of the faith.

content: 15 Brethren! in human fashion am I speaking: Yet still a man’s confirmed covenant no one setteth aside or addeth unto:
content_old: 15 Brethren! in human fashion am I speaking: Yet still a man’s confirmed covenant no one setteth aside or addeth unto:

content: 16 Now unto Abraham were spoken the promises—and unto his seed�� He saith not— And unto thy seeds､ as of many, But as of one— And unto thy seed, which is Christ:
content_old: 16 Now unto Abraham were spoken the promises—and unto his seed�� He saith not— And unto thy seeds､ as of many, But as of one— And unto thy seed, which is Christ:

content: 17 And this I say— A covenant previously confirmed by God the law which after four hundred and thirty years hath been brought into being doth not annul､ so as to do away with the promise.
content_old: 17 And this I say— A covenant previously confirmed by God the law which after four hundred and thirty years hath been brought into being doth not annul､ so as to do away with the promise.

content: 18 For if by law is the inheritance It is no longer by promise; But unto Abraham through promise hath God favoured it.
content_old: 18 For if by law is the inheritance It is no longer by promise; But unto Abraham through promise hath God favoured it.

content: 19 Why､ then､ the law? Because of the transgressions it was added､ Until such time as the seed should come､ unto whom the promise had been made, And was given in charge through messengers､ at the hand of a mediator;
content_old: 19 Why､ then､ the law? Because of the transgressions it was added､ Until such time as the seed should come､ unto whom the promise had been made, And was given in charge through messengers､ at the hand of a mediator;

content: 20 Now a mediator is not a mediator of one, But God is one.
content_old: 20 Now a mediator is not a mediator of one, But God is one.

content: 21 Is the law then､ against the promises of God? Far be it! For if a law had been given､ which had been able to give life Verily in law would have been our righteousness;
content_old: 21 Is the law then､ against the promises of God? Far be it! For if a law had been given､ which had been able to give life Verily in law would have been our righteousness;

content: 22 But the Scripture did shut up all things under sin, That the promise by faith in Jesus Christ might be given to them who have faith,
content_old: 22 But the Scripture did shut up all things under sin, That the promise by faith in Jesus Christ might be given to them who have faith,

content: 23 Before the coming of the faith however､ under law were we being kept in ward, Being shut up unto the faith which should afterwards be revealed.
content_old: 23 Before the coming of the faith however､ under law were we being kept in ward, Being shut up unto the faith which should afterwards be revealed.

content: 24 So that the law hath proved our tutor training us for Christ, In order that by faith we might be declared righteous;
content_old: 24 So that the law hath proved our tutor training us for Christ, In order that by faith we might be declared righteous;

content: 25 But the faith having come no longer are we under a tutor;—
content_old: 25 But the faith having come no longer are we under a tutor;—

content: 26 For ye all are sons of God through the faith in Christ Jesus;
content_old: 26 For ye all are sons of God through the faith in Christ Jesus;

content: 27 For ye as many as into Christ have been immersed have put Christ on:
content_old: 27 For ye as many as into Christ have been immersed have put Christ on:

content: 28 There cannot be Jew or Greek､ There cannot be bond or free､ There cannot be male and female, For all ye are one in Christ Jesus:
content_old: 28 There cannot be Jew or Greek､ There cannot be bond or free､ There cannot be male and female, For all ye are one in Christ Jesus:

content: 1 But I say:— For as long a time as the heir is an infant He differeth nothing from a servant､ though lord of all,
content_old: 1 But I say:— For as long a time as the heir is an infant He differeth nothing from a servant､ though lord of all,

content: 2 But is under guardians and stewards, until the day fore-appointed of the father:
content_old: 2 But is under guardians and stewards, until the day fore-appointed of the father:

content: 3 So also we when we were infants Under the elementary principles of the world were held in servitude;
content_old: 3 So also we when we were infants Under the elementary principles of the world were held in servitude;

content: 4 But when the fulness of the time came God sent forth his Son, Who came to be of a woman､ Who came to be under law,—
content_old: 4 But when the fulness of the time came God sent forth his Son, Who came to be of a woman､ Who came to be under law,—

content: 5 That them who were under law he might redeem, That the sonship we might duly receive;—
content_old: 5 That them who were under law he might redeem, That the sonship we might duly receive;—

content: 6 And because ye are sons God hath sent forth the Spirit of his Son into our hearts, exclaiming､ Abba! Oh Father!
content_old: 6 And because ye are sons God hath sent forth the Spirit of his Son into our hearts, exclaiming､ Abba! Oh Father!

content: 7 So that no longer art thou a servant､ but a son; And if a son an heir also､ through God.
content_old: 7 So that no longer art thou a servant､ but a son; And if a son an heir also､ through God.

content: 8 But at that time— Not knowing God Ye were in servitude unto them who by nature are not Gods;
content_old: 8 But at that time— Not knowing God Ye were in servitude unto them who by nature are not Gods;

content: 9 Whereas now— Having acknowledged God,— or rather､ Having been acknowledged by God How turn ye back again unto the weak and beggarly elementary principles､ unto which over again ye are wishing to come into servitude?
content_old: 9 Whereas now— Having acknowledged God,— or rather､ Having been acknowledged by God How turn ye back again unto the weak and beggarly elementary principles､ unto which over again ye are wishing to come into servitude?

content: 10 Days ye do narrowly observe, and months､ and seasons､ and years:—
content_old: 10 Days ye do narrowly observe, and months､ and seasons､ and years:—

content: 11 I am afraid of you—Lest by any means in vain I should have toiled for you!
content_old: 11 I am afraid of you—Lest by any means in vain I should have toiled for you!

content: 12 Become ye as I, Because I also was as ye,—brethren, I entreat you. Not at all have ye wronged me.
content_old: 12 Become ye as I, Because I also was as ye,—brethren, I entreat you. Not at all have ye wronged me.

content: 13 Howbeit ye know that by reason of a weakness of the flesh I myself announced the glad-message unto you formerly;
content_old: 13 Howbeit ye know that by reason of a weakness of the flesh I myself announced the glad-message unto you formerly;

content: 14 And your trial､ in my flesh ye despised not､ neither spat ye in disgust, But as a messenger of God ye welcomed me—As Christ Jesus.
content_old: 14 And your trial､ in my flesh ye despised not､ neither spat ye in disgust, But as a messenger of God ye welcomed me—As Christ Jesus.

content: 15 Where､ then､ is the happiness ye accounted yours? For I bear you witness—That if possible､ your eyes ye would have dug out､ and given unto me.
content_old: 15 Where､ then､ is the happiness ye accounted yours? For I bear you witness—That if possible､ your eyes ye would have dug out､ and given unto me.

content: 16 So then your enemy have I become､ by dealing truthfully with you?
content_old: 16 So then your enemy have I become､ by dealing truthfully with you?

content: 17 They shew a zeal for you､ not honourably, But wish to shut you out､ In order that ye may be zealous for them.
content_old: 17 They shew a zeal for you､ not honourably, But wish to shut you out､ In order that ye may be zealous for them.

content: 18 Howbeit it is honourable to show zeal in what is honourable at all times, and not only when I am present with you;—
content_old: 18 Howbeit it is honourable to show zeal in what is honourable at all times, and not only when I am present with you;—

content: 19 My dear children! for whom I again am in birth-pains､ Until Christ be formed within you;—
content_old: 19 My dear children! for whom I again am in birth-pains､ Until Christ be formed within you;—

content: 20 I could wish､ however､ to be present with you､ even now､ and to change my voice,— Because I am perplexed regarding you.
content_old: 20 I could wish､ however､ to be present with you､ even now､ and to change my voice,— Because I am perplexed regarding you.

content: 21 Tell me! ye who under law are wishing to be: The law do ye not hear?
content_old: 21 Tell me! ye who under law are wishing to be: The law do ye not hear?

content: 22 For it is written､ that Abraham had two sons— One by the bondmaid､ And one by the free woman;
content_old: 22 For it is written､ that Abraham had two sons— One by the bondmaid､ And one by the free woman;

content: 23 But he that was of the bondmaid After the flesh had been born, Whereas he that was of the free woman Through means of a promise.
content_old: 23 But he that was of the bondmaid After the flesh had been born, Whereas he that was of the free woman Through means of a promise.

content: 24 Which things､ indeed､ may bear another meaning; For the same are two covenants,— One､ indeed､ from Mount Sinai､ Into bondage bringing forth, The which is Hagar,—
content_old: 24 Which things､ indeed､ may bear another meaning; For the same are two covenants,— One､ indeed､ from Mount Sinai､ Into bondage bringing forth, The which is Hagar,—

content: 25 And the Hagar is Mount Sinai､ in Arabia,— She answereth､ however､ unto the present Jerusalem, For she is in bondage with her children;
content_old: 25 And the Hagar is Mount Sinai､ in Arabia,— She answereth､ however､ unto the present Jerusalem, For she is in bondage with her children;

content: 26 But the Jerusalem above is free,— The which is our mother;
content_old: 26 But the Jerusalem above is free,— The which is our mother;

content: 27 For it is written— Be gladdened､ O barren one! that wast not giving birth, Break forth and shout､ thou that wast not in birth-pains,— Because more are the children of the deserted one､ Than of her that had the husband.
content_old: 27 For it is written— Be gladdened､ O barren one! that wast not giving birth, Break forth and shout､ thou that wast not in birth-pains,— Because more are the children of the deserted one､ Than of her that had the husband.

content: 28 And we brethren, after the manner of Isaac Are children of a promise.
content_old: 28 And we brethren, after the manner of Isaac Are children of a promise.

content: 29 But just as then he that after the manner of the flesh had been born Did persecute him who had been born after the manner of the Spirit Thus also now.
content_old: 29 But just as then he that after the manner of the flesh had been born Did persecute him who had been born after the manner of the Spirit Thus also now.

content: 30 But, what saith the scripture? Cast out the serving woman and her son; For in nowise shall the son of the serving woman inherit with the son of the free.
content_old: 30 But, what saith the scripture? Cast out the serving woman and her son; For in nowise shall the son of the serving woman inherit with the son of the free.

content: 1 With her freedom Christ hath made you free. Stand fast､ therefore､ and do not again with a yoke of servitude be held fast!
content_old: 1 With her freedom Christ hath made you free. Stand fast､ therefore､ and do not again with a yoke of servitude be held fast!

content: 2 See! I､ Paul say unto you— If ye be getting circumcised Christ will profit you nothing.
content_old: 2 See! I､ Paul say unto you— If ye be getting circumcised Christ will profit you nothing.

content: 3 Yea､ I bear solemn witness again､ unto every man getting circumcised,— That he is a debtor to do the whole law.
content_old: 3 Yea､ I bear solemn witness again､ unto every man getting circumcised,— That he is a debtor to do the whole law.

content: 4 Ye have been set aside from Christ､ ye who by law are to be declared righteous,— Out of his favour ye have fallen;
content_old: 4 Ye have been set aside from Christ､ ye who by law are to be declared righteous,— Out of his favour ye have fallen;

content: 5 For we in Spirit､ by faith､ for a hope of righteousness are ardently waiting,—
content_old: 5 For we in Spirit､ by faith､ for a hope of righteousness are ardently waiting,—

content: 6 For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision availeth anything､ nor uncircumcision, But faith､ through love energising.
content_old: 6 For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision availeth anything､ nor uncircumcision, But faith､ through love energising.

content: 7 Ye were running well:— Who hath hindered you, that by truth ye are not to be persuaded?
content_old: 7 Ye were running well:— Who hath hindered you, that by truth ye are not to be persuaded?

content: 8 The persuasion is not of him that calleth you:—
content_old: 8 The persuasion is not of him that calleth you:—

content: 9 A little leaven leaveneth the whole lump.
content_old: 9 A little leaven leaveneth the whole lump.

content: 10 I am persuaded regarding you､ in the Lord— That for nothing else ye will have any regard; But he that is troubling you shall bear the sentence,— Whosoever he may be.
content_old: 10 I am persuaded regarding you､ in the Lord— That for nothing else ye will have any regard; But he that is troubling you shall bear the sentence,— Whosoever he may be.

content: 11 I however､ brethren— If circumcision I yet proclaim Why am I yet persecuted? After all the stumbling-block of the cross hath been set aside.
content_old: 11 I however､ brethren— If circumcision I yet proclaim Why am I yet persecuted? After all the stumbling-block of the cross hath been set aside.

content: 12 Oh! that they would even leave off in dismay､ who are unsettling you!
content_old: 12 Oh! that they would even leave off in dismay､ who are unsettling you!

content: 13 For ye on a footing of freedom were called､ brethren,— Only turn not your freedom into an occasion to the flesh, But by means of your love be serving one another;
content_old: 13 For ye on a footing of freedom were called､ brethren,— Only turn not your freedom into an occasion to the flesh, But by means of your love be serving one another;

content: 14 For the whole law in one word is summed up—namely in this,— Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.
content_old: 14 For the whole law in one word is summed up—namely in this,— Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

content: 15 If､ however､ one another ye bite and devour Take heed lest by one another ye be consumed!
content_old: 15 If､ however､ one another ye bite and devour Take heed lest by one another ye be consumed!

content: 16 I say､ moreover— By Spirit be walking, And fleshly coveting ye will in nowise fulfil;
content_old: 16 I say､ moreover— By Spirit be walking, And fleshly coveting ye will in nowise fulfil;

content: 17 For the flesh coveted against the Spirit, But the Spirit against the flesh,— For these unto one another are opposed, Lest whatsoever things ye chance to desire these ye should be doing!
content_old: 17 For the flesh coveted against the Spirit, But the Spirit against the flesh,— For these unto one another are opposed, Lest whatsoever things ye chance to desire these ye should be doing!

content: 18 And if by Spirit ye are being led Ye are not under law.
content_old: 18 And if by Spirit ye are being led Ye are not under law.

content: 19 Manifest however､ are the works of the flesh, which､ indeed､ are— Fornication､ impurity､ wantonness,
content_old: 19 Manifest however､ are the works of the flesh, which､ indeed､ are— Fornication､ impurity､ wantonness,

content: 20 idolatry､ enchantment, enmities､ strife､ jealousy, outbursts of wrath, factions､ divisions､ parties,
content_old: 20 idolatry､ enchantment, enmities､ strife､ jealousy, outbursts of wrath, factions､ divisions､ parties,

content: 21 envyings､ drunkenness､ revellings;— And such things as these: As to which I forewarn you､ even as I have forewarned you,— That they who such things as these do practise Shall not inherit God’s kingdom.
content_old: 21 envyings､ drunkenness､ revellings;— And such things as these: As to which I forewarn you､ even as I have forewarned you,— That they who such things as these do practise Shall not inherit God’s kingdom.

content: 22 But the fruit of the Spirit is— Love､ joy､ peace, long-suffering､ graciousness､ goodness, faithfulness､
content_old: 22 But the fruit of the Spirit is— Love､ joy､ peace, long-suffering､ graciousness､ goodness, faithfulness､

content: 23 meekness､ self-control;— Against such things as these there is no law.
content_old: 23 meekness､ self-control;— Against such things as these there is no law.

content: 24 And they who are of Christ Jesus have crucified the flesh､ with its susceptibilities and covetings.
content_old: 24 And they who are of Christ Jesus have crucified the flesh､ with its susceptibilities and covetings.

content: 25 If we live by Spirit By Spirit let us also walk.
content_old: 25 If we live by Spirit By Spirit let us also walk.

content: 1 Brethren! if a man should even be overtaken in any fault Ye､ the spiritual be restoring such a one､ in a spirit of meekness, Looking to thyself､ lest even thou be put to the test.
content_old: 1 Brethren! if a man should even be overtaken in any fault Ye､ the spiritual be restoring such a one､ in a spirit of meekness, Looking to thyself､ lest even thou be put to the test.

content: 2 One another’s burdens be ye bearing, And so fill up the law of the Christ.
content_old: 2 One another’s burdens be ye bearing, And so fill up the law of the Christ.

content: 3 For if anyone thinketh he is something､ when he is nothing he deceiveth himself;
content_old: 3 For if anyone thinketh he is something､ when he is nothing he deceiveth himself;

content: 4 But his own work let each one be putting to the proof,— And then､ for himself alone the matter of boasting shall he have､ And not for some other,
content_old: 4 But his own work let each one be putting to the proof,— And then､ for himself alone the matter of boasting shall he have､ And not for some other,

content: 5 For each one his own proper load shall bear:—
content_old: 5 For each one his own proper load shall bear:—

content: 6 Howbeit､ let him who is being orally instructed in the word, have fellowship with him that is so instructing him, in all good things.
content_old: 6 Howbeit､ let him who is being orally instructed in the word, have fellowship with him that is so instructing him, in all good things.

content: 7 Be not deceiving yourselves! God is not to be mocked; For whatsoevor a man soweth the same shall he also reap,—
content_old: 7 Be not deceiving yourselves! God is not to be mocked; For whatsoevor a man soweth the same shall he also reap,—

content: 8 Because he that soweth into his own flesh Out of the flesh shall reap corruption, Whereas he that soweth into the Spirit Out of the Spirit shall reap age-abiding life.
content_old: 8 Because he that soweth into his own flesh Out of the flesh shall reap corruption, Whereas he that soweth into the Spirit Out of the Spirit shall reap age-abiding life.

content: 9 And in doing that which is honourable let us not be fainthearted; For in due season we shall reap､ if we faint not.
content_old: 9 And in doing that which is honourable let us not be fainthearted; For in due season we shall reap､ if we faint not.

content: 10 Hence then､ as we have opportunity Let us be working what is good､ towards all,— But especially towards the family of the faith.
content_old: 10 Hence then､ as we have opportunity Let us be working what is good､ towards all,— But especially towards the family of the faith.

content: 11 See! with what large letters､ unto you I have written, with my own hand:—
content_old: 11 See! with what large letters､ unto you I have written, with my own hand:—

content: 12 As many as are wishing to make a good show in flesh The same are compelling you to get circumcised,— Only that for the cross of Christ Jesus they may not be suffering persecution!
content_old: 12 As many as are wishing to make a good show in flesh The same are compelling you to get circumcised,— Only that for the cross of Christ Jesus they may not be suffering persecution!

content: 13 For not even they who are getting circumcised are themselves observing law,— But are wishing you to be circumcised, That in your flesh they may boast themselves.
content_old: 13 For not even they who are getting circumcised are themselves observing law,— But are wishing you to be circumcised, That in your flesh they may boast themselves.

content: 14 With me however､ Far be it! to be boasting, Save in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ,— Whereby unto me a world hath been crucified､ And I unto a world;
content_old: 14 With me however､ Far be it! to be boasting, Save in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ,— Whereby unto me a world hath been crucified､ And I unto a world;

content: 15 For neither circumcision is anything､ nor uncircumcision, But a new creation—;
content_old: 15 For neither circumcision is anything､ nor uncircumcision, But a new creation—;

content: 16 And as many as by this rule shall walk Peace be upon them､ and mercy, And upon the Israel of God.
content_old: 16 And as many as by this rule shall walk Peace be upon them､ and mercy, And upon the Israel of God.

content: 17 For the rest Annoyances､ unto me let no one be offering; For I the brandmarks of Jesus､ in my body am bearing.
content_old: 17 For the rest Annoyances､ unto me let no one be offering; For I the brandmarks of Jesus､ in my body am bearing.
